intro: Centaurea ambigua, commonly known as the common centaury, is a flowering plant native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender, branching stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are blue to purple in color, with yellow centers, and bloom from late spring to early autumn. Centaurea ambigua is often found in disturbed soils and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
